name: Release v2.10.0
body:
This is a minor release.

### Added
- Add ability to use environment variables in volume paths (#192)

---

- [Download from PyPI](https://pypi.org/project/scuba/2.10.0/)
- [Read the Docs](https://scuba.readthedocs.io/en/v2.10.0/)

name: Release v2.9.0
body:
This is a minor release.

### Added
- Add ability to specify volumes in `.scuba.yml` (#186)

---

- [Download from PyPI](https://pypi.org/project/scuba/2.9.0/)
- [Read the Docs](https://scuba.readthedocs.io/en/v2.9.0/)

name: Release v2.8.0
body:
This is a minor release.

### Added
- Add ability to specify additional docker arguments in `.scuba.yml` (#177)

### Changed
- Switched testing framework from from `nose` to `pytest`

---

- [Download from PyPI](https://pypi.org/project/scuba/2.8.0/)

name: Release v2.7.0
body:
This is a minor release.

### Changed
- Switched to using `argcomplete` to provide Bash command line completion (#162)
  - When updating, remove the old `/etc/bash_completion.d/scuba` script, and enable Bash completion as described [in the README](https://github.com/JonathonReinhart/scuba/tree/master#bash-completion).

---

- [Download from PyPI](https://pypi.org/project/scuba/2.7.0/)

name: Release v2.6.1
body:
This is a bugfix release.

### Fixed
- scubainit ignores matching passwd/group/shadow file entries when creating the
  user. This allows transparently running scuba as root. (#164)
- Fixed bug where scubainit incorrectly displayed the exit status of a failed
  hook script. (#165)
- Fixed bug where user home directory was not writable when scuba workdir
  existed below the home directory. (#169)

---

- [Download from PyPI](https://pypi.org/project/scuba/2.6.1/)

name: Release v2.6.0
body:
This is a minor release.

### Added
- Add ability to override the shell in which the scuba-generated script is run, via command line option (`--shell`) or via `.scuba.yml` (#159)
- Add ability to specify in `.scuba.yml` that a particular alias should run as root (#159)

---

- [Download from PyPI](https://pypi.org/project/scuba/2.6.0/)

name: Release v2.5.0
body:
This is a minor release.

### Changed
- Use username/groupname of invoking user inside container (#153)
- Ignore already existing UID/GIDs (#139)
- Allow top-level `image` to be omitted in `.scuba.yml` (#158)

### Fixed
- Fixed deprecation error with `collections.Mapping` (#156)

### Removed
- Drop support for Python 2 (#154)

---

- [Download from PyPI](https://pypi.org/project/scuba/2.5.0/)

name: Release v2.4.2
body: This is a minor release. No new functionality is added to Scuba. However, Scuba is now built and published using [GitHub Actions](https://help.github.com/en/actions) (#152).

name: Release v2.4.1
body:
This is a patch release.

### Added
- Cache YAML documents loaded via `!from_yaml` to improve performance loading `.scuba.yml` (#149)

### Removed
- Drop support for Python 2.4 (#150)

---

- [Download from PyPI](https://pypi.org/project/scuba/2.4.1/)

name: Release v2.4.0
body:
This is a minor release.

### Added
- Enable scuba to override entrypoint via `--entrypoint` or `.scuba.yml` (#125)
- Add support for nested scripts (#128)
- Add `SCUBA_ROOT` environment variable (#129)
- Add support for escaped dots in `!from_yml` (#137)

### Changed
- Don't run image entrypoint for each line in a mult-line alias (#121)
- Use `yaml.SafeLoader` for loading config (#133)

### Removed
- Drop support for Python 2.6, 3.2, and 3.3 (#119, #130)

---

- [Download from PyPI](https://pypi.org/project/scuba/2.4.0/)

name: Release v2.3.0
body:
This minor release adds support for environment variables:
- Add a `-e`/`--env` command line option to set environment variables (#111)
- Add support for `environment` in `.scuba.yml` (#120)

It also changes the way `scubainit` is passed to the container, to avoid problems with SELinux (#117).

name: Release v2.2.0
body: This minor release fixes some bugs and allows `script` to be a single string value in the *common script schema*.

name: Release v2.1.0
body: This minor release adds the `--image` option, allowing the user to override the image from `.scuba.yml`, or to not use a `.scuba.yml` file at all.

name: v2.0.1
body: This patch release fixes a problem where the entrypoint configured in an image would be ignored when run by scuba (#83).

name: v2.0.0
body:
This release adds the following major features:
- Support for enhanced aliases (#67)
- Support for per-alias image specification (#68)
- Bash completion (#69)

Major changes in this release:
- User commands always executed via shell (#66)
- Top-level directory mounted at same path in container (#70)
- Alias names cannot contain spaces

Other changes can be found in the [Change Log](CHANGELOG.md#200---2016-11-21).

Enjoy!

name: v1.7.0
body: This release adds a new `scubainit` process which aids in the initialization of the containerized environment (see #48). It also adds support for "hooks" defined in `.scuba.yml`, which are called during this initialization.

name: v1.6.0
body: This release adds support for passing arbitrary arguments to `docker run`.

name: v1.5.0
body:
This release is a major refactoring of scuba's internals.  These changes have been made to facilitate fully automated testing.

This version adds the following new features:
- Add `-r` option to run container as root
- Add support for Python 2.6 - 3.5

The following fixes/changes were also made:
- `--dry-run` output now shows an actual docker command-line instead of a pretty-printed array
- Only pass `--tty` to docker if scuba's stdout is a TTY.
- Better handling of empty `.scuba.yml` and other YAML-related errors

name: v1.4.0
body: This release fixes problems introduced in v1.3.0, relating to the creation of user inside the container.

name: v1.2.0
body:
This release adds the following features:
-  Search up the directory hierarchy for `.scuba.yml`; this allows invoking scuba from a project subdirectory.
- Add `!from_yaml` support to YAML loading; this allows specifying image from an external YAML file (e.g. `.gitlab-ci.yml`).

name: v1.1.2
body:
This release fixes a problem when running with a remote Docker (e.g. boot2docker).

See #4.

name: v1.1.1
body:
This release fixes a bug introduced when aliases were added.
All of the version numbers are now consistent, also (in setup.py, scuba, and git).

name: v1.1
body: This release adds support for the definition of Bash-like aliases in .scuba.yml files.

name: v1.0
body: This release removes the `command` node from `.scuba.yml` files. This allows scuba to be more generally useful by no longer being limited to a single command.
